intro: Calendula cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy blooms that appear in late summer. Calendula cuneata is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses. Its flowers are also used in herbal teas and as a natural dye.
